intro: Cryptadenia grandiflora var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved cryptadenia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are broad at the base and often have a glossy texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and summer months. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
